title: Christian Wilkins says famous father Richard 'opened doors'at Channel Nine but he has 'hustled'
text:
He's the socialite son of Today Show entertainment presenter Richard Wilkins, 65.

And on Saturday, Christian Wilkins revealed he still has to 'hustle' for success, despite his famous father scoring him an interview at Channel Nine.

Speaking to Stellar Magazine, the 24-year-old said Richard's reputation actually made it harder to land his current job as a social media producer at the network.

'I know I'm lucky': Christian Wilkins (pictured) told this week's Stellar magazine that while his famous father Richard has 'opened doors' and got him a job at Nine the socialite has had to 'hustle' for everything he has

'I know I'm lucky. My dad very much helped me get my job at Nine. Everything else, however, I've had to hustle for,' Christian said.

'I mean, my father can make that first introduction but then you need to go into that room and wow them 1000 times more because of it.'

He added: ' But I acknowledge that I did get to walk into that room to begin with.'

Footsteps: 'My father can make that first introduction but then you need to go into that room and wow them 1000 times more because of it,' Christian said. Pictured with father Richard

Comparisons: Christian said he often finds himself comparing his career to his father's. 'Sometimes he (Richard) has to remind me that he didn't start working on TV until he was 31,' he said. Pictured with father Richard in 2015

Apart from his Channel Nine gig, Christian co-hosts the Radical Fashionism podcast with his boyfriend Andrew Kelly.

He also presents E! Australia fashion segments and is a part-time model.

Despite his well-rounded success, Christian said he often finds himself comparing his career to his father's.

Busy: Apart from his Channel Nine gig, Christian co-hosts the Radical Fashionism podcast with his boyfriend Andrew Kelly. He also presents E! Australia fashion segments and is a model

Luxe! The model's Instagram profile documents his lavish lifestyle and partying. However, Christian insisted that he actually prefers cooking and cleaning. Pictured with his father in a social media snap

'Sometimes he (Richard) has to remind me that he didn't start working on TV until he was 31. So Dad's like, 'You're 24 and you're doing all this. You need to remember where you are, too',' he said.

The model's Instagram profile documents his lavish lifestyle partying, meeting celebrities and attending fashion events.

However, Christian insisted that he actually prefers cooking and cleaning to help his father rather than partying.
description: He's the socialite son of Today Show entertainment presenter Richard Wilkins.
authors: Shive Prema For Daily Mail Australia
